page.title: 06Churches and Religion Part 2
page.content: 3.The Kingdom Hall of the Jehovah's Witnesses in Hill Road. 4.A Christadelphian Hall in Coleridge Vale. 5.The Religious Society of Friends (The Quakers)in Albert Road. 6.A Christian Science Society in Old Street. 7.The Salvation Army in Old Street. 8.A United Reform Church,which shares with St.Peters in Alexandra Road. St.Andrews,sometimes known as Old Church dates from the twelfth century and is the oldest building in Clevedon. St.Peters is the only twentieth century church in the town.It replaced a tin building in 1970 at a cost of Â£20,000,a gift from Dame Violet Wills. Most of the internal furnishings were also gifts.The font is almost unique( the only other one is in Australia)
